items.title: Former Tesla president discloses the secret to scaling a company
items.description: “We scaled Tesla in 30 months from $2 billion in revenue to $20 billion in revenue,” said Jon McNeil, who is now co-founder and CEO of DVx Ventures.

items.title: Why Cartken pivoted its focus from last-mile delivery to industrial robots
items.description: Cartken started seeing an influx of demand for its last-mile delivery robots from industrial customers and is now focused on that sector.

items.title: Tesla loses its charm for India’s loyalists — even as Musk finally delivers
items.description: Tesla's debut in India has not convinced its early backers, who waited for the company to enter the market for nearly a decade.

items.title: Microsoft says it will no longer use engineers in China for Department of Defense work
items.description: Following a Pro Publica report that Microsoft was using engineers in China to help maintain cloud computing systems for the U.S. Department of Defense...

items.title: Astronomer CEO resigns following Coldplay concert scandal
items.description: Andy Byron, the startup executive at the center of an extraordinary social media furor, has resigned as CEO of data operations startup Astronomer.
